*Steps to replicate*
 # Install a fresh new confluence 6.5
 # Set user language to Россия
 # Do a encoding test, and noticed the rest result was fine:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 # AppLink the instance and create a jira link
 # View issue is affecting jira links in confluence


h2. Expected Result

The top Jira link counter on the Confluence page should be properly interpreted into the User Profile's selected language even when there are two or more Jira links on the page.
h2. Actual Result

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

*Update: 27/Mar/2018*
This issue is affecting the description of the "Share" button when you're hovering over it as well:
 !encoding.png|thumbnail!

https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/download?lang=nl_NL#/Confluence/6.1.0] from translations.atlassian.com the character ï is translated as ? symbol. 

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install Dutch language pack to the confluence. Link: https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/download?lang=nl_NL#/Confluence/6.1.0
# Click the {...} menu on a confluence page and you will notice the ï is translated as ? symbol. 
Ps: the character ï is render correctly when user insert the text in confluence page,

The character is translated correctly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If profile language changed to German, notifications should also be in German, instead, most of it is English and the last word is German.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Mention a user whose profile is set to German

h3. Expected Results
* Notification will be showed as *User mentioned you in this* in the local language, in the list or expanded the view

h3. Actual Results
* Both, list and expanded notification will be in English with last word *this* being in German:
*User mentioned you in dies*
See image below:
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-06 at 15.14.26.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Notifications mention is not translated to German

fields.description:
h2. Summary of Issue

When adding more than one Jira Issue Macro link to a Confluence page, the Top Link Counter shows weird characters when the User Profile has set their Language setting to Chinese or Japanese. When there is just one Jira Issue Macro link on the Confluence page, the Top Link is displayed and interpreted properly to the User's language setting.
h2. How to reproduce
 # Install Confluence 6.5.0
 # Install Jira 7.5.2
 # Connect the two via Application Links with oAuth with Impersonation
 # On *Confluence side*:
 ** Create a new blank page with title called *Jira Link Page*
 ** Paste in one Jira Issue Link
 ** The top Link Counter on the Confluence page shows 1 LINK
 ** Paste in another Jira Issue Link
 ** The top Link Counter on the Confluence page shows 2 LINKS
 ** Now, update your *Profile* » *Settings* » *Edit* and change the Language to Chinese or Japanese
 ** Navigate back to the Confluence *Jira Link Page*
 ** The top counter will show 2 but weird characters (x)
 ** Edit the page and delete one of the JIM links. The top counter will 1 Link interpreted properly in the User Profile selected language

h2. Expected Result

The top Jira link counter on the Confluence page should be properly interpreted into the User Profile's selected language even when there are two or more Jira links on the page.
h2. Actual Result

!JiraCounterLink_incorrectlydisplay.png|thumbnail!
h2. Notes
 * The Jira Link Counter is generate by the 'Confluence JIRA Metadata Plugin'
 * This problem seemed to be caused by the translations in the language pack
 -- Updated the translations as follows and the problem should be solved when the language pack will be built next time
 --- [https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/originalMessage/85401?lang=zh_CN]
 --- [https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/originalMessage/241006?lang=zh_CN]
 --- [https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/originalMessage/241006?lang=ru_RU]
 --- [https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/originalMessage/85401?lang=ru_RU]
 --- [https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/originalMessage/241006?lang=ko_KR]
 --- [https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/originalMessage/85401?lang=ko_KR]
fields.summary: Jira Link counter on a Confluence page does not display properly when User has selected non-english in their User Profile

fields.description:
h3. Desciption
When using a date picker in a Confluence page in other languages the month is shown incorrectly. It appears to have a null or blank after the month and year. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 7.0.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the profile language to a non US/UK language
 # Create a new Confluence page and add a date
 # The picker is shown with the month and the incorrect translation or bug

h3. Expected Results
The month and year is shown correctly without any suffix.

h3. Actual Results
In Russian, the month and year is shown as "Сентябрь 2019нет"
In German, the month and year is shown as "September 2019Null"
In Finnish, the month and year is shown as "Syyskuu 2019tyhjä"

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Languages month/year is shown incorrectly in date picker

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

When Jira issue macro attempting to filter something that does not exist in JIRA side, the Jira Issue Macro Column Titles are not translated
!image-2018-10-29-19-38-54-187.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a Jira Issue Macro, Filter to an existing project
# Change the language to German language
# Refresh the page. The Jira Issue Macro Column Titles will change to german
# Go to Jira and delete the project specified
# Go back to Confluence page. The Jira issue macro will show an error that "Jira project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it." corectly


h3. Expected Results
The titles of the column are still translated to German

h3. Actual Results
The column titles does not translated to German
 
h3. Notes
Issue happens when other languages are set as well.
More information, refer to the MP4 attached [^CONFSERVER-57435.mp4].
* It seems like these column title during this situation, does not have its own keys yet.
* Keys are needed to be able to be translated
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro Column Titles are not translated when JIRA filter does not exists

fields.description:
h3. Bug Summary:

Health check notification email encoding issue (French language)
h3. Steps to replicate
 * Add mailing server to Confluence
 * Change default language to French
 * Go to Confluence Administration -> Troubleshooting and Support tools.
 * Go to "periodic scan"
 * Enable periodic scan, add start time and recipients email.
 !Screenshot_20190305_171644.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected results

Email notification body should use title:
{panel}
Résultats de l'analyse des journaux pour YYYY-MM-DD.
{panel}
h3. Actual results

Email notification body uses title:
{panel}
Ru00E9sultats de l'analyse des journaux pour YYYY-MM-DD
{panel}
!Screenshot_20190305_164648.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Navigate to:
 <confluence_directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins

 # run following command to find corrupted entry:
{code:java}
zipgrep  Ru00E9sultats  confluence-language-pack-fr_FR-6.14.0.rc1-20190118093317.jar
{code}

 # use vim (on linux) to open confluence-language-pack-fr_FR-6.14.0.rc1-20190118093317.jar
 # navigate to package:
{code:java}
i18n/troubleshooting_fr_FR.properties
{code}

 # locate the line:
{code:java}
stp.scheduler.hercules.mail.subject=Ru00E9sultats de l''analyse des journaux pour
{code}

 # replace Ru00E9 with é character
fields.summary: Health check notification email  encoding issue (French language)

fields.description:
Once you link Jira Service Desk with Confluence to create a Knowledge Base the *Search help* button appears under the main search bar so that you can obtain assistance on how to perform the search. However, the *Search help* button is not translated to French and the contents accessed when you click the button are also displayed in English, is this something we can fix?

Steps to access.

First, you will need a Jira Service Desk instance, then you will need to link it to Confluence so that the *Search help* button appears. 

# Click on the *Jira Administration Icon* > *Projects*.
# Select a Jira Service Desk project.
# You will be taken to the *Project Settings* page.
# Click on *Knowledge Base*.
# Click on *Link to a Confluence Base*.
# On the *Access* section, mark *All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license*.

Now we can actually access the page where the *Search help* button is displayed.

# At the sidebar click on *Customer channels*.
# A box will appear, click on *Visit the portal*.
# You should be able to see the search bar and the *Search help* button.
# Click on *Search help and the contents will be displayed on English.

Steps to access it on French.

# At the sidebar click on *Canaux de clients*.
# A box will appear, click on *Visit le portail*.
# You should be able to see the search bar and the *Search help* button.
# Click on *Search help and the contents will be displayed on English.

I have performed these tests on Jira Service Desk 4.4.1
fields.summary: The Search help button and its contents are not translated on Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
Hi, We need translations for a new request type on the SAC form in Portugese and Japanese. 

 
||English||Japanese||Portugese||
|I want to nominated someone for Partner of the year award| | |
|"Partner of the Year awards recognize a diverse set of Partners from around the globe who are helping customers unleash their potential using Atlassian tools in innovative ways. Interested in submitting a nomination? Please check out [this page|https://partners.atlassian.com/display/resources/Partner+Awards+2019] to learn more about the awards, the eligibility criteria and the awards available for Partners."| | |
|Award Category| | |
|DevOps, ITSM, Agile, Rising Star, Emerging Markets, Marketing Innovator, Enterprise, Technology Innovator, Business Teams, Cloud, Services| | |
|Partner Name| | |
|Company's full name to be displayed on the award.| | |
|Provide a summary explaining your achievements. Don't be afraid to brag, include tangible facts and figures to support your claims, we love to see what our Solution Partners have achieved. | | |
|Please note we will only pay attention to the first 500 words.| | |

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37718].
  {panel}

Despite being in the translation packs, some strings are not being translated. This affects all bundled languages - French, German, Spanish and Japaneses. It likely affects non-bundled language packs as well.

Affected areas discovered so far include:
* Meeting Notes Blueprint
* Watch in pages
* Task Report Macro
* Installer
* Welcome message on the dashboard

h3. Cause
The mismatch occurs when the user's language is different from the global language. In some places, the global language is preferred over the user's. 

h3. Workaround
If it is feasible, ensure that the global language (Confluence Admin > Languages) is set to the same language as the end user's. The end user should also ensure that their browser language is set to their preferred language.
fields.summary: Some strings are not translated in all languages

fields.summary: Poorly translated Dutch strings (Cloud)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user with a French locale browser access a page created by another user with an English locale browser, the French locale browser user can't sort the Jira Issues macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have two users
-- One with an English locale browser and profile language set to "_Automatically detect browser setting_"
-- One with a French locale browser and profile language set to "_Automatically detect browser setting_"
# The user with the English locale browser creates one page and add a Jira issues macro on this page filtering to show some issues, then save the page
# The user with the French locale browser access this page and click on the header of the Jira issues macro to sort it

h3. Expected Results
The Jira issues macro is sorts accordingly.
h3. Actual Results
The Jira issues macro returns an error saying the user doesn't have permission to view the issues or they don't exist.
 !error.gif! 
 
h3. Notes
Note that the first time the user with French locale browser access the page the issues can be viewed, so it isn't a permission issue.

h3.Workaround
Go to the user's profile and change the Language option from "_Automatically detect browser setting_" to another option.
fields.summary: Users with French browser locale can't sort Jira issues macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the German translation for Confluence notification is grammatically incorrect. It should be "User Name hat diese Seite bearbeitet" not "haben" as 3rd person singular is "hat" (english "has" and 3rd person plural is "haben" (english "have")

Also, "B" is missing and it should be "Benachrichtigungen verwalten" (english Manage Notifications).
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.1147.0
h3. Expected Results

The email notification should be "User Name, hat diese Seite bearbeitet"

"Benachrichtigungen verwalten"
h3. Actual Results

The email notification is "User Name, haben diese Seite bearbeitet"

"enachrichtigungen verwalten"
fields.summary: Incorrect Grammar on German translation for Confluence notification

fields.summary: Wrong translation for Overview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JIRA macro in Confluence doesn't show the translated Jira custom fields based on the language of the user

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira, create an issue with a custom field with a field name (for example, Test custom)
# Translate the above custom field with a filed name to Spanish
# In Confluence create a page with JIRA macro with the above Jira issues
# In Display options of the macro, insert the custom field and publish the page
# Login to Confluence and Spanish user (language set to Spanish in personal settings) and navigate to the Confluence page with JIRA macro
# Edit JIRA macro and insert the custom field and publish the page.
# Switch to Confluence page of the English user and the custom field description is not shown.
# Now as an English user, try to reinsert the custom filed and publish the page
# Navigating to Spanish user's Confluence page doesn't show the custom filed description

h3. Expected Results
Custom filed description should show based on the language of the user

h3. Actual Results
Translated custom filed description is not shown to users based on the language used

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JIRA macro doesn't show the translated Jira custom fields description

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Epic Link* value is not displayed in *Jira Issue Filter* if the language set in the user profile is not _English_.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your language in your profile to *Spanish*.
# Check a page where a *Jira Issue Filter* is displaying Jira issues with Epic Link.

h3. Expected Results
The *Epic link* value is properly displayed

h3. Actual Results
The *Epic link* value is empty.
 
h3.Workaround
Switch back your language to *English* to have the value displayed again.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro will not show Epic Link value if the language is not set to English

fields.description:
h3.Summary
If user's browser is set to a language, the indexing language "English" field is overridden by the browser's language. 

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Change browser's language to any language
# Go to *Settings*
# Under *General Configuration* in *Formatting and International Settings* section, see that the Indexing Language is now set to the Browser's language
# Click *Edit*

h3.Expected Behaviour
The Indexing Language should be either "Other", or the current browser language

h3.Actual Results
"English" (the 0 index from the list), is overridden by the Browser's language
fields.summary: Browser's language overwriting Indexing Language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a page is creating using a browser with a French locale and the user's profile language is set to "_Automatically detect language_" where a table is added to the page and dates are added to this page, after the page is saved sorting the table using the date column gives an incorrect sorting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a browser with a Non-english locale and the Confluence user profile language set to "_Automatically detect language_"
# Create a page and add a table to the page
# Populate the table and user one column to add dates using //
# Save the page and sort the table using the dates column

h3. Expected Results
The sorting respects the ascending or descending dates.
h3. Actual Results
The sorting is incorrect.

h3.Workaround
Create the page using the English locale.
fields.summary: Sorting date within table is wrong when the page is created using a Non-English locale browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43385].
  {panel}

h5. Summary:
In Confluence 5.8, when using the German Language pack, the date picker:
* Has Monday as the first day of the week
* Days are displayed in German 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

However, In Confluence 5.9 and above, when using the German Language pack, the date picker:
* Has Sunday as the first day of the week
* Days are displayed in English
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Notes:
Checked in {{confluence-language-pack-de_DE-5.10.0.rc1-v2r12978-2016-06-06.jar/i18n/aui_de_DE.properties}} noticed the line
{{ajs.datepicker.localisations.first-day}} was set to {{1}}, 
{code}
ajs.datepicker.localisations.first-day=1
{code}
which supposed to set the day picker to start on Monday. However, the date picker still shows Sunday as the first day of the week

Most of European countries start the week with Monday, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Week.
h5. Workaround:
No workaround yet
fields.summary: Date Picker no longer set to Monday On European Languages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33713].
  {panel}

# Create a custom field in JIRA.
# [Translate custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+a+Custom+Field#ConfiguringaCustomField-Translatingacustomfield] into another language (language B)
# Change JIRA language to language B
# Ensure Confluence is in language A. 
# Insert JIRA issues macro and adjust display options to ensure it will include custom field.
# Custom field will display in language B, the other fields in language A, matching Confluence's profile language.
# Change JIRA back to language A. 
# Check Confluence, custom field is still in language B.
# Edit page, re-insert JIRA issues macro, and language will now be in language A.
# Change Confluence to language B, custom field is still in language A

Tested in English/Japanese, and it's reported also in English/German
fields.summary: Translations for Custom JIRA Fields in Issues Macro do not match Confluence Language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From approx. 17/Sep/2019, the German translation on the Space overview page has broken and the language on some buttons is now English.  According to this comment, the German word for "Blog" is "Blog" -  so the translation for that particular button may not be required.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the Confluence language settings
 # Navigate to a space overview page
 !Screenshot 2019-10-18 at 12.35.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
 * The buttons for "Overview", "Blog" and "Space settings" are in English

h3. Actual Results
 * Those buttons should be in German - this was the case in the past

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Space overview - German translation broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Editing Confluence page with the S3.Translator plug in installed causes Firefox to stop responding and with Chrome, it locked up. 
 * Simply edit the page, either copy or cut some content to reproduce.

h3. Environment

Firefox 56.0.2 (64-bit) in win7
 Google S3 translator 6.4 Add-in

Able to replicate on Mac OSX 10.12.6

Chrome Version 61.0.3163.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)

56.0.2 (64-bit)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Script stalls and reports:
 A script on this page may be busy, or it may have stopped responding.
 You can stop the script now, or you can continue to see if the script
 will complete.
{code:java}
Script: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__synchrony-2Dcdn.atlassia&d=DwIDaQ&c=wBUwXtM9sKhff6UeHOQgvw&r=RpkFJg0zdLBNL1xGEAcRMxuAqIGVCMDxfjtq3Qm-I9Xjou9qiw1kK1-LRXPXxsJ-&m=Kxg6ZbMShj-_ldbIBZQreB8IjIXZkuL2B67UVH3_1Rg&s=8m6jFLQR_bYLd2cgPNZ1xCY0ztdS70X7GhNC_ZrA1Yc&e=…/resources/js/synchrony.min.js:1751{code}
 
h3. Expected Results 
h3. * successful editing with updated content appended.
h3.  Actual Results
h3. * Changes are lost as well as page content.
h3. Notes
 * When editing with plug in installed with Chrome, the page hard locked, content was lost and had to force quit out browser session. 

h3. Workaround
 - Removing/Disabling the S3 add-on allows editing to transpire.
fields.summary: Editor breaks with S3.Translator add-on installed

Instead of *Nome* (name), it's displayed as *Mome*

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The date representation of the /date (or /datum?) command is not localized. In german for example, the short form should be 'Di., 15. Aug.' instead of 'Thu, 15 Aug' in the new editor.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1.Create a page in new editor add ([]) check box and add ( // )calendar.
 # Step 2 Select a date , date is not translated in german language.

h3. Expected Results: It should be 'Di., 15. Aug in the German language.
h3. Actual Results: It shows in the English language  'Thu, 15 Aug'

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The date representation of the /date (or /datum?) command is not localised.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36560].
  {panel}

h3.Step to replicate
# Create a page with a Task Report Macro 
# Change the language setting  for the user to a non English language
# Go back to the page.

h3. Expected Result
The Task Report Macro is displayed in the selected languages


h3. Observed Result
The Headers of the Task Report Macro are not translated even when a different languages is selected.
!test_1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Cause
The mismatch occurs when the user's language is different from the global language. In some places, the global language is preferred over the user's.

h3. Workaround
If it is feasible, ensure that the global language (Confluence Admin > Languages) is set to the same language as the end user's. The end user should also ensure that their browser language is set to their preferred language.
fields.summary: Task Report Macro Headers field from Confluence Inline Tasks plugin are not translated.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding dates in a page through "//" shortcut, the selected date doesn't persist.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Have an instance in Santiago - Chile timezone
 ## Change the timezone setting in local computer.
 ## provision a new instance.
 # Create a page
 # Add a date using "//" shortcut
 # Select April 7th, 2019, for example
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected behavior

The page should shows "April 7th".
h3. Current behavior

The page shows "April 6th".
h3. Workaround

Select the day after. It will then show the day before.
fields.summary: Date macro displays the wrong date when the user is in Santiago/Chile timezone

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the addition of new languages in the Confluence Cloud ecosystems, users opting for Danish or having Danish browser settings and the "detect browser settings" feature enabled  have noticed that some menu elements in the Danish translation of Confluence are in Finnish. This is the same issue as can be seen in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52633 . 
 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Set Confluence Cloud site-level language settings to Danish, or have Danish as the selected language in browser and the "detect browser settings enabled."

h3. Expected Results
All interface items should be in Danish.

h3. Actual Results
Some interface items are in Finnish.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround, save for switching back to English.
fields.summary: The language pack for Confluence Cloud is not complete and it mixes Danish with Finnish

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing the TOC macro with the interface in French, the help text below the field "list style" (for the example in the attachments, there are other fields impacted) includes translated special values: "disque" instead of "disc", "cercle" instead of "circle", etc. while using these values in the field won't work.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1 - Change the language of the instance to French.
# Step 2 - Go to the test space and create a test page over there.
# Step 3 - Now, add Macro Table of Content and type disc in "list style". And the suggestion in the help text below the "list style" field will be "disque".

h3. Expected Results
Either the translated values should be accepted by the field, or the helper translation should use the actual untranslated values (or, when applicable, a drop-down would be even better).

h3. Actual Results
The translated values are not accepted.

h3.Workaround
NA
fields.summary: Translated suggestion under list style field does not work for Table of content macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using French translation, not all texts are translated.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.456.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the language to French
# Take a look at the left-hand menu where you can see "Backup Manager" and other options like "User Management" and "Billing" not translated. These are just some examples
# Additional examples
Space Settings name page
Header and Footer page in Appareance
Application Links and Slack Notifications in Integrations
Overview page.

h3. Expected Results
All text and features should be translated
h3. Actual Results
Some individual parts of Cloud are not translated.
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: French language does not translates everything in Cloud

When an attachment gets uploaded, the correct message should be: "약 3 시간 전에 첨부"

fields.summary: String concatenation causes incorrect translation in Korean

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
1. If you have chosen to use 'Automatically detect browser setting' on your Confluence Profile and you set the browser language to the German language. it doesn’t translate all the options into the German language on the page(Workflow History, Attachments, page flow History, page information, etc.)

2. Indexing language getting change based on user regional language in browser, if browser language is Spanish then indexing language also showing Spanish.


h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1.Set the language in a user's profile settings as "Automatically detect browser setting".
 # Step 2.Set the German language in browser settings.
 # Step 3. Verify the page *created by/updated by* options and click on three dots(menu) and check other options, all options doesn’t show in the German language.

h3. Reproduce steps for indexing language issue:
1. Go to administration > General configuration > check indexing language > it is English.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
2. Created a new user added in administration permission 
3. Set regional language in browser settings(try Spanish) 
4. Login as new user.
5. Check your user profile language, it will show Spanish as per browser language.
6. Go to administration > General configuration > check indexing language.
7. It shows Spanish as per browser language.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results: All listed options should be in the German language but it shows mixed languages and indexing language should not be change.
h3. Actual Results: Only a few options are showing in german and indexing language also changes to browser language.

h3. Workaround
User can select the  language manually from the drop-down under language settings to get the expected results.
fields.summary: 'Automatically detect browser setting' doesn’t translate all options according to browser selected languages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Space Directory page has some typos in the text translated to Portuguese. Where it reads:
{code}Os Espaços são ótimos para organinzar conteúdos relacionados. Comece por criar um espaço para a sua equipa ou um projeto em que esteja a trabalhar. Saiba mais.{code}
The word *_organinzar_* should be replaced to *_organizar_*.
The word *_equipa_* should be replaced to *_equipe_*.
Also, the title of the page should have the word *_Espaço_* written in plural *_Espaços_*. (In English it makes sense to leave it in singular form "Space Directory", in Portuguese not so much).

Another one since you're at it: The profile settings should change the word *_Parametros_* to *_Configurações_* (It makes more sense in Brazilian Portuguese).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Confluence language to Portuguese
# Go to the Space Directory

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Typos in translation to Portuguese

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you have chosen to use 'Automatically detect browser setting' on your Confluence Profile and you set the browser language to Dutch language. The date formats when using date picker in Page Properties is different with Page Properties macro. It's also different when adding a date picker to a page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the language in a user's profile settings as "Automatically detect browser setting". 
# Set the Dutch language in browser settings 
# Try to create dates with the help of the date picker.
# Insert the Page Properties and Page Properties Report macros.
# Insert date picker to a page.

h3. Expected Results
* Date formats should be the same and it should follow the desired language.

h3. Actual Results
* The date formats when using date picker in Page Properties is different with Page Properties macro. It's also different when adding a date picker to a page.
fields.summary: Date picker language translation doesn't work properly

I'm using the French language with confluence 6.15.1.
Create then choose the "DACI decision" but try it with a french profile you will find "Décision PACI".
I want to replace PACI everywhere with DACI and also there is a tradition bug in the description see in the attachment file I pointed out in red.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Profile > Settings and change language to French
# Create new content and choose "DACI decision" template

h3. Expected Results
Créer une DACI, À propos des décisions DACI, En clarifiant qui joue quel rôle dans chaque décision dès le départ

h3. Actual Results
Créer une PACI, À propos des décisions PACI, En clarifiant à l''
 !Bleuprint DACI.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
I found several bugs in Czech translation of Confluence for Cloud. Please see attached screenshots.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check screens based on the attached images.

h3. Actual Results
Incorrect translations. See images:
 !confluence-translation-all-updates.png|thumbnail!  !confluence-translation-block-formatting.png|thumbnail!  !confluence-translation-edit-invitation.png|thumbnail! 
 !confluence-translation-find-replace.png|thumbnail!  !confluence-translation-formatting-bar.png|thumbnail!  !confluence-translation-formatting-bar.png|thumbnail! 
 !confluence-translation-invitate-users.png|thumbnail!  !confluence-translation-links.png|thumbnail!  !confluence-translation-markup.png|thumbnail! 
 !confluence-translation-personal-context-menu.png|thumbnail!  !confluence-translation-sidebar.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes
I like Confluence very much and therefore I took voluntarily role of Confluence evangelist in our company a year ago. I see quite regularly that some terms in current translation are really confusing even for skilled users. And believe me please, it is a whole different story for newbies that I try to convince to use your product.

Can I somehow help/contribute to polish these errors in our language?
fields.summary: Czech translation bugs

fields.description:
On the People page, under a team where it says "Open team", this text is translated incorrectly in Swedish. In Swedish, it's translated as "Open team", with "open" as in "open (the) team" or "open the door", so it looks like a call-to-action.

 

Instead, it should say "Öppet team", which is the adjective form. :)
fields.summary: People and Teams - Incorrect translation for "Open team" in Swedish

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using languages like Italian or Japanese, the months are spelled differently, for example, "September" is spelled "Settembre" in Italian. Therefore, the short form is "Set" instead of "Sep". 

Using the Date picker (calendar icon), it'll automatically fill up the date format whenever you choose the date, which will turn out to be 12/Sep/19 instead of 12/Set/19 (when using the Italian language). This will throw an error stating that the date format is incorrect.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your user language to Italian or Japanese
# Use the Date picker for any Date field.

h3. Expected Results
* The date should automatically translate the month to the language used. 

h3. Actual Results
* The date didn't translate the month to the language used.

h3. Workaround
* Manually edit the spelling of the month to reflect the proper spelling of the language.

h3. Notes
In some languages, the AM/PM is spelled differently, which will cause the invalid date format error to occur as well.
fields.summary: Date picker don't translate months to other language automatically

fields.description:

Incorrect translation "Comment" = "Komkmentit".
Correct translation "Comment" = "Kommentit".

See attached screenshots.

In the old issue view, the translation is correct:

New Jira issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change profile language to "Suomi"
# Go to any Jira issue (New Jira issue view) and scroll down to the Activity section.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description: User profile page is not localized. Some strings appear in English, some strings appear in the language Jira provisioned. In the attached screens current language is Spanish and provisioning language is Russian.
fields.summary: User profile page is not localized
Some strings on a Project default board are not translated

fields.description:
There are many places where Date/Time is not localized. Very often Calenar component that appears to the right from date/time input field is not localized as well. The places where I found it listed below. The screenshots are attached.
 # Date/Time labels and Calendar component are not localized in
 Select Project->Backlog->view issue in the very right column-> select Log Work. If you enter a value in the entry field as prompted you will have a validation error. This is global. Checked for Russian, Polish and German.
 # Issues->Issue->Log Work
 # Releases->Edit Version

One more place is Backlog Screen-> Start Sprint Button. In the popup window we have unlocalized date format. According to translation expert opinion it should be It needs to be YY/MM/DD.
fields.summary: Date/Time and Calendar component not localized in many places

fields.description: In all Jira reports on [Jira Core Documentation for Reporting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/reporting-765593792.html] that display a chart, the time units on the horizontal axis are not localized.
fields.summary: Horizontal axis labels are not localized in Jira specific charts

fields.description:
Some strings on "Create issue" and "Edit Issue" screens are not localized, as well as Project Type dropdown on Projects screen).

Note that the following strings from the screenshots are from the Jira Software fields:
 * Epic custom fields
 ** Epic
 ** Epic Link
 ** Epic Status
 ** Choose an epic to assign this issue to.
 * Sprint custom field
 ** Sprint 
 ** Jira Software Sprint field
 * Rank custom field
 * Story Point custom field

See the JSWCLOUD-17005 for more details for JSW side.
fields.summary: Some strings on "Create issue" and "Edit Issue" screens are not localized

fields.description:
It seems all languages still have "System Dashboard" in English. The string is likely sourced from

jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/startupdatabase.xml and jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/startupdatabase.xml

and

jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/startupdatabase.xml and jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/startupdatabase-vertigo.xml . 

<!-- The default dashboard -->

    <PortalPage id="10000" pagename="System dashboard" sequence="0" favCount="0" layout="AA" version="0"/>

...
fields.summary: "System dashboard" and possibly other default strings are not localized

fields.description:
h3. Summary of bug
JIRA might not recognise the dates properly, even when they are set according to the date picker format

h3. Steps to replicate

# Set JIRA to use one of the affected languages (more on that later). For now we shall use Swedish
# Set the Sprint end date
# The result is as follows :
* !Jira error sprint start.PNG|thumbnail! 


*Possible Workaround:*
- Change the date format from _22/Dec/17_ to _22.12.17_ with the below setting in _Advanced Settings_:
{noformat}
jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm
jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA does not recognise some dates set in foreign language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The delete project confirmation page is not properly translated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Set the JIRA user's language to a non-English language.
- Navigate : Cog Menu > Projects
- Click on the delete against one of the projects.

h3. Expected Results

The warning message and the project details on the confirmation page should be translated to the user's language.

h3. Actual Results

The confirmation page is shown in English.

 !translate.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Delete project confirmation is not translated

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is a delay for the translation Jira provides when setting your default language to something other than English.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your language to Russian in your [Personal settings|https://featureflagjunky.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa]
# Go to any Issue in Jira and refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

The page is expected to load in the default language selected.

h3. Actual Results

The page first loads in English then gets translated a second after (or sometimes several seconds).

 !2019-10-22_14-53-37.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Notes

This behaviour is seen for most languages outside of English and happens in both the new and old Jira issue view.

h3. Workaround

I found that using the [Atlassian navigation extension|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/atlassian-navigation-exte/flioipdmdipioibnnoekkadfcoelelil] for Chrome eliminates this problem though this is only applicable for Chrome users.
fields.summary: Delayed translation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For Russian language, the fields for the created date and updated date of an issue are not showing the correct date when hovering over it.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to _Your Profile_ name.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
 # Edit _Preference_
 # Select language Russian and Update
 # Open an issue
 # Hover over the field that shows the created/updated date of the issue.

h3. Expected Results

The date and time of the created/updated issue is shown correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The date and time is not shown in the correct format. See below:

!image__2_.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: For Russian language the date of the issues is displayed incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For French language, the creation date which corresponds to "now" is displayed wrong: "à linstant" instead of "à l'instant".
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud ADG3
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Your Profile name.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
 # Edit Preference
 # Select language French and Update
 # Create a new issue
 # Open this issue.
 # Check fields: "Création" and "Mise à jour"

h3. Expected Results

Création: À l'instant
Mise à jour: À l'instant
h3. Actual Results

Création: À linstant
Mise à jour: À linstant

!Screen Shot 2018-01-02 at 15.49.20.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

no workaround
fields.summary: For French language, the creation date "now" is displayed wrong "à linstant" instead of  "à l'instant"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User has noticed a number of corrections to be made on the general JIRA Project and content mostly regarding to the German language Deutsch (Deutschland) translation of the JIRA description. User also noticed some content which was not translated to German language as well.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Project > View All Project > Choose a Project > Click on Project Settings
 # Click on Field tab, the header will be translated but the below title will remain untranslated.
 # !german01.png|width=697,height=299!
 # Next, if you go to Administration > System > Issues > Status
 # The "To Do” label. This is translated as “Aufgaben”, but it should be “Zu erledigen”. “Aufgaben” is ill-placed and sounds like a result of some kind of automatic translation.
 # !German02.png|width=760,height=58!

h3. Expected Results

To be able to read the correct translation of the JIRA description in the German language.
h3. Actual Results

Grammatical errors and failure to translate the content into the German Language
h3. Screenshot provided
fields.summary: German Language Translation of JIRA Description is Incorrect

fields.description:
Customer has raised a feedback on the inaccurate Danish translations in JIRA.

{quote}
Yes. I am using the danish language settings in JIRA.

I am about to introduce JIRA in our company, which is used to danish language in software, but I know, I will be laughed at with some of the current translations :-)

Danish IT "lingo" is heavily influenced by english, and in many cases we actually just use the english words.

Here are some of the first examples that meets the eye (screenshots attached), but there are probably more if we dig deeper. 

* _Instrumentbræt_ refers to a dashboard in a car, but nobody would use that word for a software dashboard. Just use Dashboard in danish as well.
* _Episk_ is the correct translation for Epic as an adjective, but the word does not exist as a noun in danish. Just use Epic in danish as well
* _Historik_ means history (for instance a list of log entries), and does not make sense as a translation for Story. Just use Story in danish as well.
* Issue is not consistently translated. I have seen it called _Emne_ (which means topic),  _Opgave_ (which means task) and _Aktivitet_ (which means activity). _Sag_ is actually a better word to use.
* Board is not consistently translated. In some places it is called _Tavle_ , in other places Panel. _Tavle_ is usable, but i would personally use the word Board in danish as well.
* _Udgivelse_ is used for a book release, but never for a software release. Just use the word Release in danish as well.
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve the Danish translation

fields.description:

There's a typo on the signup page for Korean Language.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Spanish translation of Webhook configuration is outdated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the webhook page:
 ## instanceURL.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/webhooks
 # Click on *Create webhook* 
 # Set an HTTP URL.

h3. Expected Results
*  You should receive an error message saying that only HTTPS is valid.

h3. Actual Results
* It shows an error message saying that either HTTP or HTTPS is valid and you are not able to save your configuration.

*Note*:
English error message:
{noformat} Invalid URL. The only allowed protocol is HTTPS. {noformat}

Spanish error message:
{noformat} URL inválida. Los únicos protocolos permitidos son http y https. {noformat}

h3. Workaround
Use an HTTPS URL instead.
fields.summary: Spanish translation of Webhook configuration is outdated

fields.description: Needs to be translated.
